commit.message: Add another wacky armour name to artefacts.
Add another "other" name to artefact weapons.

Updated options_txt with talismans for autopickup

[Committer's note: Removed "%" from the default list, as talismans are
not actually picked up by default.]

Fix player orbs often preventing blocks from working (WizardIke)

An orb the player had equipped would be returned by you.shield(), despite
not being a shield. This had the indirect effect of preventing the player
from blocking many things, due to the block limit of an orb being 0.
(Whereas not having any 'shield' at all gives a block limit of 1). This
meant that, no matter how many other sources of SH the player might have,
such as amulets of reflection, Qazlal, or mutations, they would be unable
to block. Even Divine Shield didn't work on spell projectiles (though, by
coincidental differences in codepath, it did work on melee and ranged
attacks).

Now player::shield() can only return actual shields (amusingly enough,
monster::shield() did already work properly). actor::offhand_item() is
added for the few cases where we just want to know if some non-weapon is
taking up that slot, whether a shield or not.

Make a few small fixes to overflow altars

fedhas_altar_fruit_tree: remove a spurious C that got slipped into the
    map somehow
vehumet_statue: put back a removed SHUFFLE so now the second kind of
    statue can appear

Fix "input" messages from client being reordered

All the messages that the webtiles client sends back to the server
should arrive in the order they were send. However, due to the way in
which we were converting messages of type "input" into console input, it
could be reordered with respect to other messages. Commit fc0747a made
it common for "input" messages to be reordered before other messages
that give keycodes instead of being extremely rare making this
reordering problem very noticeable. To fix this, add a new "text_input"
message type which doesn't suffer from reordering and use it instead
(the old "input" messages type needs to remain unchanged so that
servers can still run old versions of the game).

Handle singular "the " names in encounter msgs.

So we get e.g. "You encounter the Serpent of Hell." instead of "You
encounter Serpent of Hell."

Note that a hypothetical unique monster with both a "the " name and a
title (none currently exist) will have its title take precedence.
Fix uniques' titles not being used in encounter messages (Snakku)

Remove some oddly well-commented dead code

This statement was seemingly never live in trunk, and doesn't seem relevant
for how golem currently operates. It already can act immediately on the
turn you move towards it, regardless of this.

Perhaps this is a remnant of an older version of it that never made it to
trunk at all?

Fix a couple tiny tesseract bugs

Due to function ordering, only one of the two tesseracts was actually being
woken up when they activated (the only effect this had was on stabability,
if that one somehow remained unalerted long enough to walk up to it).

Also, fix the second tesseract still not disappearing from monster memory
when the first was killed.

Make lua you.contaminated() return something more useful

It is renamed you.contamination() and returns the player's current
contamination percentage. (Instead of merely whether this was above 0%)

Improve the UI regarding contamination explosion damage (Odds)

The % screen now indicates the maximum damage the player could take from
their current level of contamination, if it were to explode. They are also
prevented from resting if this explosion is capable of killing them.

This number is also exposed to lua via you.max_contam_damage() (mostly so
that the Contam status tooltip can also list this number). A very minor bug
with how the tooltips are refreshed means that if the player gains an XL
without any status changes, the tooltip may very slightly underestimate the
max damage (but % will still be accurate).

Give monster alerts even if a monster causes an interrupt

Many interrupts will cause a prompt on their own, which made this
additional more seem somewhat superfluous, but travel won't, so probably
it's more consistent if it always does.
Mark erythrospites as no_poly_to

Don't special case handling of green water

Instead, use the same colour override code used for other tiles to
select the correct tiles for green and light green water.

Yet further very brief vault review

Worthy of note:

 * Pan entries now guarantee a tier 2 demon, instead of presenting the
   entirely harmless premise of being interrupted in exploration to find
   a vault containing exactly one Lair-portal threat of a tier 3 demon.

 * muffindrake_necropolis_ghost_three_little_ghosts has had its terrain
   shuffles fixed to no longer require as much digging charges to access.

 * Orc special rooms in V now match the threat level of Elf's, to match
   how the orc warlord bands in V no longer use nearly as much low-tier
   orc chaff as previously.

 * wad_dig_loot uses a cacodemon in Elf alongside a demonologist, since
   the elementalist placed in there can no longer dig itself out.

Fix sometimes getting incorect monster leaves view messages

If a monster enters view and then isn't in view at the start of the
player's next turn, we print a message so that the player isn't confused
about things like auto explore being interrupted with no monster in view
etc. However, because we printed the messages about monster's leaving
view before decaying clouds, a monster could move behind enough fog
clouds to be out of view and then we would print the message and then
the fog clouds would decay putting the monster back in view. This would
leave the player with a confusing message about a monster leaving view
when all the monster's were still in view.
Add another name change option for graffiti.

Add Shapeshifting professors to graffiti.

Use "talismancer" as one of the names for them, so that fewer of them
sound like shapeshifters as in the monster type. (It's taken from an old
Evocations title that was removed in 1880023187 when talismans and
shapeshifting were added. It seems appropriate here since shapeshifting
requires talismans.)
Add another ordinary meeting to graffiti.
Add Invocations/Evocations professors to graffiti
Reorder a graffiti professor section.

Fix resizing the console in webtiles

When playing webtiles on a console, the game has to wait for input from
the console as well as from the websocket connection (to handle tiles
spectators joining). We were doing this by using `select` on stdin and
the websocket, however, we wouldn't stop waiting when a window resize
signal was triggered. To fix this, use `pselect` and handle the `EINTR`
result it returns to stop waiting and handle resize signals when they
arrive.

Better name finding for Jiyva beam absorption.

Fall back to beam flavor name if the beam name is empty.
Closes #3717.

Reduce resonance damage.

Now provides 1.5% per sklevel, down from 2%.

feat: show failure rates of abilities in chardump (#4821)

Shows failure rates of abilities in the chardump `a:` list, e.g. `a:
Oozemancy (3%), Slimify (12%)`, similar to the passive effects list in
format.

There were a couple of times that either me or my friends wanted to know
the failure rates of abilities without having to start the game. I'm not
sure if it's intuitive enough so that most people won't mistake it for
success rate, or something else. Maybe showing a table like the spell
library can be better?

feat: show failure rates of abilities in chardump (#4821)

Shows failure rates of abilities in the chardump `a:` list, e.g. `a:
Oozemancy (3%), Slimify (12%)`, similar to the passive effects list in
format.

There were a couple of times that either me or my friends wanted to know
the failure rates of abilities without having to start the game. I'm not
sure if it's intuitive enough so that most people won't mistake it for
success rate, or something else. Maybe showing a table like the spell
library can be better?

commit.message:
Fix: adjust the nameless infernalist trove.

Don't spawn monsters on the inside.

Improve wizmode parchment handling.

Allow specifying a parchment spell in &o. Default to generating a parchment
rather than the first book containing a spell when providing a spell name.

Fix: let spriggan druids boon while blind.

The type of monster_near_iterator used required the druid to actually be able
to see the monster, meaning that blinding them prevented it from working.
Appears to be unintended, so use the other monster_near_iterator instead.
Do the same for pharaoh ant bind souls, just in case.

Fixes #4308

Let draw out power cure mesm and fear.

Free your mind. Closes #4444.

Fix glowing message with helmets of light.

Change "orb" to "armour", since the light ego can show up on either
helmets or orbs (although orbs of light only exist as monk starting
equipment).

Closes #4937.
fix a spell menu description
Add a few more bland names.
Let necromancers be professors in graffiti.

Adjust titles for people/professors in graffiti.

They now get more options.

Fix errant newline in lindwurm quote.

Closes #4934.

Simplify some graffiti messages.

Don't explicitly mention that some things are local. It's implied.

Expand Dith & equivalent graffiti a bit.

Assume the ones practising thievery are using code phrases so as not to
bring the authorities down on them.
Add Lugonu & equivalent to graffiti.
Add the Shining One & equivalent to graffiti.
Tweak a Wu Jian Council graffiti message.
Expand Zin messages and tweak a Beogh message.
Add Ru & equivalent to graffiti.
Fix typos.
Add another Beogh religious graffiti line.
Expand a non-religious graffiti line.
Add Ashenzari to religious graffiti.
Fix some religious graffiti wording.
Add Elyvilon & equivalent to graffiti.
Expand non-religious graffiti a bit more.

Split off non-religious/religious graffiti.

Since there's some major overlap.
Add Qazlal to religious graffiti.
Add the Wu Jian Council to religious graffiti.
Add Dithmenos to religious, etc. graffiti.
Add Uskayaw to religious graffiti.
Add Hepliaklqana to religious graffiti.
Add Fedhas to religious graffiti.
Add Makhleb to religious graffiti.
Add clarifying comment.

Fix errant newlines in oklob plant quote.

Closes #4930.
Add a few more bland names.
Sort bland names alphabetically.
Add another graffiti section.
Add more unique-related graffiti.
Tweak a graffiti "quality".
Add more species-related graffiti.
Add another graffiti rumour.
Add a few more graffiti religion entries.
Expand a graffiti line.
Show graffiti on all dry fountains too.

Show graffiti on all blue/sparkling fountains.

Make sure a rare chance for it is in both the peaceful and drfault
fountain options; in the latter case, it should still be noticeable
with monsters around.
Fix fountain key typos.
Add another Xom stone arch message.

Make Xom messaging more consistent.

Walls briefly shown on the other sides of arches are now explicitly
described as translucent, and such walls can get both colour patterns
and graffiti, just as translucent walls in the dungeon can, as a hint to
the player. (The faint coloured flames are left out, but we assume the
player can't see them from their distance away.)
Add another graffiti short saying.

Expand graffiti insults a bit.

To include qualities as well as relatives.
Simplify a graffiti "happened" reason.
Add another short saying to graffiti.

Suppress Time-Warped Blood while worshipping Chei

It hastes things, after all.

Fix monster ranged attacks not producing ME_WHACK events

It turns out that monster ranged attacks didn't wake monsters because of
actually hitting them; no events were fired for doing this at all. They
woke monsters because they happened to also produce noise at the target
cell. (This is why Dith shadow shot was failing to off-screen monsters that
it was buggily shooting - their actions are always silent.)

But there are other consequences to using only ME_ALERT events from noise:
monster ranged attacks could not break fear or daze on other monsters, and
they were probably also incapable of distracting them.

Now monster ranged attacks should alert their targets in more or less the
same way that monster melee attacks do.

This fixes #4503 (along with the previous commit)

Fix Dithmenos shadow archer mimic rarely being able to shoot out of LoS

This generally required that the player trigger the mimic by a shot that
killed their primary target, and with an out-of-los enemy directly in the
path of a ray fired at the now-dead target, while the shadow was not yet
visible on the field. (Most other methods of getting the shadow to pick a
random target did respect your LoS, but this method of determining the
'primary shot direction' could be fooled.

This fixes part of #4503

Fix autoexplore trying to cross deep water when in non-swimming temp forms

If the player's base form was able to swim, but their current form was not
(for instance, if they were normally a rime yak, but currently in flux
form), autoexplore would still try to move them into water, resulting in a
flurry of "Why would you want to do that?"

This fixes #4532

Don't remove paragon status when a phantom mirror copy dies

This prevented using your paragon's charge-up move, giving it additional
attacks whenever you attack, and getting the defense bonus.

This fixes #4717

Fix monsters not casting LRD through grates

This fixes #4840

Wake monsters on attack, even if the attacker is now dead (Ge0FF)

As an example, if a walking alembic hit a sleeping monster as the final hit
of their potion countdown and immediately died, the monster they hit would
not wake up or otherwise notice the damage they'd just taken.

This is not the only way an attacker can die in the process of attacking,
and probably it is correct in all cases to actually alert/wake the
defender (I hope).
Flag Warp Body and Mutagenic Gaze as chaotic (Acrobat, Darby)

Have explore alarm traps make noise immediately

Since 372a382 made explore traps happen at start of turn, the noise from an
alarm trap wouldn't happen until the *end* of the current turn, resulting
in confusing messaging (ie: the monsters will all shout *after* you did
whatever it was you were doing).
Don't let Dazed monsters follow the player across stairs (Acrobat)

Don't abort Infernal Servant + Carnage on too little space near you (Lici)

With Mark of Carnage, Infernal Servant doesn't necessarily place its demons
near the player and so shouldn't abort for lack of space if the area near
you is crowded.

Make Clarity prevent Fear in monsters (Acrobat)

A long-standing bug that was just a lot less noticable when monsters could
only obtain this from artefacts instead of it being present on a unique.

Fix a handful of issues with the player losing flight

Landing due to emergency flight wearing off was not triggering location
effects at the landing site.

'Floosh!' was not being properly printed if flight was lost over shallow
water (important!).

Taking off armour of flight was attempting to interrupt its own delay
(reported by Odds). Losing flight should now only interrupt travel delays
and not other delays.

Remove some trailing spaces from monster encounter messages

These were usually invisible, but could sometimes result in a confusing
semicolon being inserted between messages.

Interrupt travel when teleportitis kicks in (Odds)

So that the player has a chance to cancel it with ?tele if they wish to.

Add a static targeter for invisibility

Which monsters can see invisible is somewhat ideosyncratic and it can be
easy for a player to assume that an invisibility potion will be a lot more
useful in a particular situation than it actually will be.

As such, this adds a static targeter that hilights which monsters in view
cannot see invis (and thus will be fooled) by you either drinking or
evoking invis. Additionally, if there are monsters in sight but ALL of them
can see invis, it will ask the player directly if they're sure they want to
do this.

This targeter is enabled by default, but can be turned off with
show_invis_targeter = false

Fix a very minor issue with the Silence targeter

Power over 100 was already capped at radius 5, so it was only in incredibly
narrow circumstances where the difference from old code would matter (ie:
when exactly 1 more power would increase the maximum radius).

Slightly improve some static scroll targeters

?silence wasn't using the Silence spell's targeter (which is more accurate,
but did not exist the last time this code was touched), and both ?summoning
and ?butterflies could arguably have been better.

New option: force_scroll_targeter

This works much like force_spell_targeter and force_ability_targeter,
making default use of certain scrolls show static targeters despite being
unaimed.

This is enabled by default for fear, silence, vulnerability, immolation,
and torment. (Fear was particularly important, since the only way to see
your success chance previously was to either quiver or use via F, which is
something not all players were aware of, and also can run into key
conflicts since consumable inventory was added. But I think it can be
helpful for these other scrolls, as well.)

Since a targeter is effectively already a level of 'confirmation' that
requires an additional key before using, warnings about using dangerous
scrolls will be suppressed if that scroll has a targeter enabled.

Make show_paged_inventory default to true

I originally kept the 'old' appearance of the inventory menu due to people
saying they missed being able to see all of their items at once, but after
some time and debate, I feel like the number of newcomers confused by their
letter keys not always doing what they expect may outweigh this.

(Suggestions about making pressing a letter which is 'overloaded' bring
up a sub-menu asking the player which of those items they want to select
may not be a bad future direction, but the implementation work is sadly
quite a bit more complex, I think.)

Fix a crash with Beogh-converted orcs leaving the floor immediately (Kush)

Converting an orc that first moved into your LoS on its own turn, and was
already standing on a way to leave the floor, would crash on checking for
monster_alert (since it was now MONS_NO_MONSTER).

(Converting orcs on stairs by *you* moving into LoS of them worked safely,
due to seen checks happening in a different order.)
Add clarifying comments.
